intro: Psychotria subvelutina, commonly known as the velvet psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria subvelutina is also known for its potential psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine.
